frame.name: Regard
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Cognizer</fen> has a <fen>Judgment</fen> of an <fen>Evaluee</fen>, expressing how high or low their regard for the <fen>Evaluee</fen> is.
<ex><fex name="jud">What</fex> do <fex name="cog">you</fex> <t>think</t> <fex name="eva">of him</fex> <fex name="rol">as a linguist</fex>?</ex> <ex><fex name="cog">She</fex> <fex name="man">secretly</fex> <t>thought</t> <fex name="jud">well</fex> <fex name="eva">of him</fex> <fex name="rea">for his role in defrocking Mr. Matthews</fex>.</ex> <ex>Please understand, <fex name="cog">I</fex> <m>hold</m> <fex name="eva">you</fex> <m>in</m> the <fex name="jud">highest</fex> <t>regard</t>.</ex> <ex><fex name="cog">My</fex> <fex name="jud">low</fex> <t>opinion</t> <fex name="eva">of him</fex> was of long standing.</ex>
<ex></ex> <asf>ASFALDA French FrameNet comment</asf> : <ex></ex>
≠ <frframe>Judgment</frframe> : the LUs of the Judgment do include the polarity of the evaluation, which is not the case for the LUs of Regard.
</def-root>

FE.name: Cognizer
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the one that makes a <fen>Judgment</fen>. This role is typically expressed as the External Argument (or in a <ment>by</ment>-PP in passives).
<ex><fex name="Cognizer">The boss</fex> <t>appreciates</t> you for your diligence.</ex> <ex><fex name="Cognizer">The boss</fex> is very <t>appreciative</t> of my work.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Evaluee
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Evaluee</fen> is the person or thing that a judgment is made with respect to. With verbs this FE is typically expressed as Object: <ex>He <t>regarded</t> <fex name="eva">her</fex> poorly.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Reason
FE.definition:
<def-root>There may be a constituent expressing the <fen>Reason</fen> for the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s judgment. It is usually a <ment>for</ment>-PP.
<ex>I <t>think</t> highly of you <fex name="Reason">for your honesty</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Role
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Role</fen> is used for the capacity in which the<fen>Evaluee</fen> is judged, and is expressed in <ment>as</ment>-PPs.
<ex>My high <t>regard</t> for you <fex name="rol">as a composer</fex> is due strictly to political concerns. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Judgment
FE.definition:
<def-root>A description (from the point of view of the <fen>Cognizer</fen>) of the position of the <fen>Evaluee</fen> on a scale of approval.
<ex>I hold him in the <fex name="jud">highest</fex> <t>esteem</t>.</ex></def-root>
